boat.full_description:
In 1899 the decision was first made to adopt a new class of boat for Hoylake Sailing Club. The gaff rigged, 16 foot clinker boats were developed from a design by Captain Winchester, a club member, and built by Alex Latta, also a club member and owner of a Smiths Bros boat yard. Opera class racing commenced at Hoylake in June 1902. The fleet grew quickly to 17 and has raced regularly since then.

In 1909 Orchid sailed from Hoylake to Ardrossan and on to Ballycastle in Northern Ireland.

14 boats of the Opera class remain today in Hoylake with another, La Poupee on display in the Merseyside Maritime Museum. The class has therefore stood the test of time although some boats have been inevitably been lost over intervening years.

Princess Ida was built in 1931 to replace the previous Opera No7 Rose-Marie, and her recent restoration has taken her out of the class due to rig changes.
boat.name: Princess Ida
boat.short_description: Under going restoration by Mike Cottam Southport
